author: Special Correspondent
text:
Says those sharing the motto of heralding a change are welcome

Former CPI State Secretary D. Pandian, on Thursday, categorically stated that the People’s Welfare Front, of which his party is a constituent, is not ready to “beg” anyone to join the alliance though it is open to joining hands with like-minded parties.

Addressing a press conference here, Mr. Pandian said the PWF was the result of the sour experience that the other parties in the alliance have had with the two major Dravidian parties. He said the people of Tamil Nadu were looking for a change from the misrule of the AIADMK and the DMK and the PWF was a reflection of this.

Rubbishing reports that he was trying to secretly strike a deal with the AIADMK, Mr. Pandian said neither the party nor any individual belonging to the CPI has had any contact with the ruling party ever since the alliance broke in 2014.

On more parties joining the PWF, he said those sharing the motto of heralding a change was welcome. “But we do not have the habit of begging outside anyone’s house,” he asserted. He also blamed the DMK of trying drive a wedge between the constituents of the PWF.
title: Won’t implore anyone to join People’s Welfare Front: Pandian
